intro: Sanicula orthacantha var. costata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sanicula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves with a distinctive ribbed or ridged appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. This variety is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
